meanings.definition: To insert a blank leaf or leaves between the pages of (a book, document, etc.).
meanings.sent1: She interleaves colorful pages in her scrapbook to make it more interesting.
meanings.sent2: The librarian interleaves protective sheets in rare books to preserve them.
meanings.sent3: The student interleaves funny notes in his textbook to surprise himself later.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter interleaves with the music, creating a joyful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The chef interleaves layers of flavors in her signature dish for a unique taste experience.

meanings.definition: A blank leaf or leaves inserted between the pages of a book, document, etc.
meanings.sent1: The old manuscript had delicate interleaves to protect the fragile pages.
meanings.sent2: He found a pressed flower hidden in the interleaves of the ancient tome.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves to play with the interleaves of the notebook, making a mess.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight filters through the interleaves, casting patterns on the floor.
meanings.sent5: The artist uses colorful interleaves to add a pop of brightness to the artwork.
